rules.natural: If a Game requires Technology, then the Game is profitable.
Under the condition that an Organization develops a Game, if the Organization is funded, then Technology is licensed.
Should a Game be in alpha testing, then it enters beta testing.
Assuming a Game is in beta testing, an Organization develops the Game.
If a Game is in early access, then its release is delayed.
Provided an Organization has a marketing campaign, if it is not the case that the Game being released implies it is profitable, then the Game enters early access.
An Organization has a marketing campaign or it issues a press release.
If an Organization issues a press release, then it releases a demo.
Given that an Organization releases a demo, whenever the Game's release does not imply profitability, the Game enters early access.
If a Game requires Material, then it is profitable.
Provided that a Game is successful, it is profitable.
If a Game has high ratings, then it is successful.
Under the condition that a Game is popular, it has high ratings.
Either a Game is multiplayer or it is singleplayer.
If a Game is singleplayer, then it is profitable.
Under the condition that a Game has online features, it is profitable.
Provided that a Game is esports ready, it has tournament support.
A Game is esports ready or it has a ranking system.
An Organization uses a Platform or the Game requires Technology or the Game requires Material.
Provided that a Game has matchmaking, then if it has a ranking system, a competitive mode leads to multiplayer games having online features.
If Technology is proprietary, then it is open source.
Under the condition that a Game is crossplatform, if Technology is open source, then it is not outdated.
If a Game is released on Steam, then it is crossplatform.
A Game is released on Steam or it is released on Epic.
If a Game has a console release, then if it is released on Epic, it is crossplatform.
Under the condition that a Game has a mobile release, if it is released on Epic, then it is crossplatform.
A Game is released on Xbox or it is released on PlayStation.
If a Game is released on PlayStation, then it has a mobile release.
Provided that a Game has a PC release, it is released on Switch.
If an Organization is crowdfunded, then it is not approved.
If an Organization is a small team, then it is an indie developer.
An Organization is a small team or it is a large studio.
Should Material be compatible with a Platform, then the Organization does not use the Platform.

Under the condition that a Game has optimized performance, if it uses a licensed engine, then a large studio developing it implies publisher backing or the Game not being profitable leads to crowdfunding.
If a Game has advanced graphics, then should it use a custom engine, it has optimized performance.
Provided that a Game has refined gameplay, an Organization develops the Game.
If a Game is in early development, then it has buggy gameplay.
A Game is in early development or it is in late development.
Should a Game be in late development, then it enters the polishing phase.
Provided that a Game is in the polishing phase, it reaches gold master.
Under the condition that an Organization has a partnership with Technology, Technology is licensed.
If an Organization has an acquisition offer, then it has a merger proposal.
Provided an Organization has an acquisition offer, it does not have a merger proposal.
If an Organization has community engagement, then whenever the Game's release does not imply profitability, the Game enters early access.
Should Technology be outdated, then Material is not outdated.
If a Game is trending, then it is controversial.
Provided that a Game is banned in some countries, it is not controversial.
A Game is banned in some countries or it is age restricted.
A Game is family friendly or, if it is age restricted, then it is not controversial.
A Game is award winning or it is critically acclaimed.
Provided that a Game is critically acclaimed, it is successful.
If a sequel is planned for the Game, then under the condition that it is award winning, it is successful.
Should a spin-off be planned for the Game, then the franchise has not ended.
Provided that DLC is planned for the Game, it has microtransactions.
DLC is planned for the Game or it has an expansion pack.
Under the condition that a Game has an expansion pack, it has tournament support or a competitive mode leading to multiplayer games having online features.
If Technology is licensed, then the Organization is not approved.
Provided that the Game's release does not imply it is profitable, its release is not delayed.
If it is not the case that Technology's compatibility with a Platform implies Material's compatibility, then Technology is proprietary.
Should the implication that Technology is compatible with a Platform leads to Material being compatible fail, then Technology is outdated.
Under the condition that Technology's compatibility with a Platform does not imply Material's compatibility, Material is outdated.
Should a Game's release on Xbox not lead to a console release, then it has a PC release.
If a Game's release on Xbox does not imply a console release, then it is not released on Switch.
Provided that having microtransactions does not imply tournament support or a competitive mode leading to multiplayer games with online features, the Game uses a subscription model.
Should the implication from microtransactions to tournament support or competitive mode with multiplayer online features fail, then the Game does not use a subscription model.
If mod support does not lead to a ranking system resulting in competitive mode with multiplayer online features, then the Game has workshop integration.
Under the condition that mod support does not imply a ranking system with competitive mode and multiplayer online features, the Game does not have workshop integration.
Should the negation of the implication from funded Organization to partnership not lead to an investment round, then the Organization has an acquisition offer.
Provided that the negation of the implication from gold master to refined gameplay does not result in certification pending, the Game's certification has failed.
If the negation of influencer support or community engagement does not lead to viral marketing, then the Organization runs an ad campaign.
Under the condition that the Game not being popular does not imply it is not mainstream, it is trending.
If a Game is not popular, then it is niche.
Provided that a Game is not popular, it is mainstream.
If a Game does not have matchmaking, then it has local play.
Provided a sequel is not planned for the Game, the franchise has ended.
Under the condition that a sequel is not planned, a spin-off is planned.
Should a Game not be profitable, then the Organization is funded.
Provided that a Game is not profitable, the Organization is approved.
